sources.title: Sherlock Holmes In Washington
sources.description: Sherlock Holmes and Doctor Watson travel to Washington D.C. in order to prevent a secret document from falling into enemy hands.

sources.title: Sherlock Holmes in Washington (1943)
sources.description: In World War II, a British secret agent carrying a vitally important document is kidnapped en route to Washington. The British government calls on Sherlock Holmes to recover it. Watch on RetroFlix:  https://retroflix.org/sherlock-holmes-in-washington-1943/

sources.title: Sherlock Holmes in Washington
sources.description: Title: Sherlock Holmes in Washington Summary: Sherlock Holmes and Doctor Watson travel to Washington D.C. in order to prevent a secret document from falling into enemy hands. Directed by: Roy William Neill Actors: Basil Rathbone, Nigel Bruce, Marjorie Lord Production Company: Universal Pictures Release Date: 30 April 1943 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 Sherlock Holmes is engaged by the Home Office to locate a British subject traveling for his law firm to Washington, D.C. The man had flown to New York City and then took the train to Washington. On the outskirts of the city, the man was kidnapped and has not been seen for several days now. Holmes learns from the Home Office that the man was in fact a government agent who was delivering a highly secret, two page document to the US government. In verifying the contents at his flat, Holmes concludes the document had been reduced to microfilm. The question becomes whether he may have had the opportunity to pass the microfilm to someone else on the train before he was taken.

sources.title: So This Is Washington (1943)
sources.description: Lum and Abner go to Washington to aid in the war effort by giving the government what they think is a good substitute for rubber--Abner's homemade licorice. Watch on RetroFlix:  https://retroflix.org/so-this-is-washington-1943/

sources.title: So This Is Washington
sources.description: You can find more information regarding this film on its IMDb page .

sources.title: So This Is Washington (1943) LUM & ABNER
sources.description:
Stars: Chester Lauck, Norris Goff, Alan Mowbray
Director: Ray McCarey

Lum and Abner go to Washington to aid in the war effort by giving the government what they think is a good substitute for rubber--Abner's homemade licorice.

Chester Lauck and Norris Goff portrayed the characters Lum and Abner on different radio networks from 1931-1954. In his 35 year career on radio and movies, Chester Lauck has never played any other character except for ol lovable Lum Ed'ards (Columbus Edwards).

metadata.Plot: Sherlock Holmes is engaged by the Home Office to locate a British subject traveling for his law firm to Washington, D.C. The man had flown to New York City and then took the train to Washington. On the outskirts of the city, the man was kidnapped and has not been seen for several days now. Holmes learns from the Home Office that the man was in fact a government agent who was delivering a highly secret, two page document to the US government. In verifying the contents at his flat, Holmes concludes the document had been reduced to microfilm. The question becomes whether he may have had the opportunity to pass the microfilm to someone else on the train before he was taken.
metadata.Writer: Bertram Millhauser, Lynn Riggs, Arthur Conan Doyle
metadata.Actors: Basil Rathbone, Nigel Bruce, Marjorie Lord
